Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Propofol's Immunomodulatory Effects in Sepsis

Participants.evidence: Peripheral blood monocytes from septic patients and healthy volunteers were also studied

Intervention.evidence: macrophages from Rab5a−/− and WT mice treated with lipopolysaccharide (LPS) or cecal ligation and puncture (CLP)

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the mechanisms underlying propofol's immunomodulatory activity

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in membrane TLR4 expression, measured over 24 hours

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed using sealed envelopes

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors

Result_Outcome.evidence: Propofol significantly reduced membrane TLR4 expression on macrophages in vitro and in vivo
